comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The former Nina Floyd Crosby, daughter of Walter Floyd Crosby (d. 1915, age 59). She was the wife of a Louisiana senator, James Biddle Eustis (one S), from 1903 until he also died in 1915, age 44. Then in 1917 she married a Frenchman, Marie Charles Jean Melchior (1880-1950), the Marquis de Polignac: fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marie_Charles_Jean_Melchior_de_Poli...

comment.author: 34985608@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the information.  We'll add it to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: This site says that James Biddle Eustis died in 1899 at age 65. bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=E000229

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Hmm, looking closer:  she seems to have been married in 1903 to a younger James Biddle Eustis (1870-1915, Harvard class of 1894), son of James Biddle Eustis the senator; this woman's husband was apparently not the senator.

Just to make it more interesting, Nina Crosby and JBE had a son who was also called James Biddle Eustis.
